fields.label: Type
fields.name: gs_type
fields.instructions:
Select type of global section.
Headers & Footers need to be manually assigned in Customizer > Header (Footer) > General , or for specific pages, into the page' custom options.
Generic sections can be assigned to different page positions, either in Customizer > General > Generic Sections (for site-wide usage), or specific pages, into the page' custom options.

fields.label: Enable Layout for Elementor Canvas Template?
fields.name: enable_canvas
fields.instructions: Enabling this option will display this section on pages using Elementor Canvas Template.

fields.label: Elementor Canvas Position
fields.name: canvas_position
fields.instructions: Select where to add.

fields.label: Mega Menu
fields.name: mega_menu
fields.instructions: Activate the mega menu for this menu item.

fields.label: Mega Menu Type
fields.name: mega_menu_type
fields.instructions: Select the type of mega menu. Columns will only show submenu trees into columns, while Global Sections allows much more complex layouts.

fields.label: Menu Columns per row
fields.name: mega_menu_columns
fields.instructions: Select how many columns per row.

fields.label: Select Global Section
fields.name: menu_global_section
fields.instructions: Select the global section to load in this mega menu panel.

fields.label: Panel layout
fields.name: panel_layout
fields.instructions: Select the panel's layout

fields.label: Custom Info
fields.name: product_info
fields.instructions: Select if you want to show or hide the Custom Info content, which is displayed after the product summary. The content is pre-defined in "Customizer > WooCommerce > Product Page - Content" panel. You can also select Custom content, and you will be able to override it.

fields.label: Custom Content
fields.name: product_info_content
fields.instructions: Override the custom content pre-defined in "Customizer > WooCommerce > Product Page - Content" panel.

fields.label: After product summary section
fields.name: product_content_after_summary
fields.instructions: Select a global section to append after this product page's summary section.

fields.label: After content
fields.name: product_content_after_content
fields.instructions: Select a global section to append after this product page's content (after reviews).

fields.label: Content *Before* Add to cart button
fields.name: enable_text_before_add_to_cart
fields.instructions: Select if you want to show some content *Before* the Add to Cart button. You can globally assign content on all products by accessing "Customizer > WooCommerce > Product Page - Components" panel and enable the "Text Before Add to cart button" option.

fields.label: Custom text before Add to cart button
fields.name: text_before_add_to_cart

fields.label: Content *After* Add to cart button
fields.name: enable_text_after_add_to_cart
fields.instructions: Select if you want to show some content *After* the Add to Cart button. You can globally assign content on all products by accessing "Customizer > WooCommerce > Product Page - Components" panel and enable the "Text After Add to cart button" option.

fields.label: Custom text After Add to cart button
fields.name: text_after_add_to_cart

fields.label: Badge Type
fields.name: badge_type
fields.instructions: Select the product badge type

fields.label: Badge Text
fields.name: badge_text
fields.instructions: Add the text inside the badge.

fields.label: Text Color
fields.name: badge_text_color
fields.instructions: Select the text color

fields.label: Background Color
fields.name: badge_text_bg_color
fields.instructions: Select the background color

fields.label: Text Size
fields.name: badge_text_size
fields.instructions: Select the text size.

fields.label: Text Size (Tablet)
fields.name: badge_text_size_tablet
fields.instructions: Select the text size.

fields.label: Text Size (Mobile)
fields.name: badge_text_size_mobile
fields.instructions: Select the text size.

fields.label: Image size
fields.name: badge_image_size
fields.instructions: Select the badge maximum width.

fields.label: Image size (Tablet)
fields.name: badge_image_size_tablet
fields.instructions: Select the badge maximum width.

fields.label: Image size (Mobile)
fields.name: badge_image_size_mobile
fields.instructions: Select the badge maximum width.

fields.label: Show badge on mobile
fields.name: badge_show_on_mobile
fields.instructions: Select if you want to show or hide the badge on mobiles.

fields.label: Badge Position
fields.name: badge_position
fields.instructions: Choose position in product item in catalog page.

fields.label: Video URL
fields.name: product_video_url
fields.instructions: Supports YouTube and Vimeo urls.

fields.label: Tabs
fields.name: product_custom_tabs
fields.instructions: These tabs are created in Customizer > WooCommerce > Product page - Tabs panel.

title: Singular Settings (Post, Page, Product)

fields.label: Page Cover
fields.name: page_cover
fields.instructions: Enable/disable or change the pre-assigned page cover in Customizer > Page Cover.

fields.label: Body CSS Classes
fields.name: rey_body_class
fields.instructions: Add CSS classes that will be appended to the body tag's class attribute.

fields.label: Header Text
fields.name: header_text_color
fields.instructions: This will override the Header's text color. Please know that some elements may not be colored properly, so in such cases it's probably recommended to customize the colors right into the Header Global Section you're currently using.

fields.label: Header Position
fields.name: header_position
fields.instructions: Select how the header will position itself on top. This option will override the one selected in Customizer > Header > General. Read more about Header Positions and Overlapping Content

fields.label: Overlap Content
fields.name: header_fixed_overlap
fields.instructions: If enabled, the header will behave like "relative" header. This option will override the global option set in Customizer > Header > General > Header Position -  Overlap Content.

fields.label: Overlap Content (tablet)
fields.name: header_fixed_overlap_tablet
fields.instructions: If enabled, the header will behave like "relative" header. This option will override the global option set in Customizer > Header > General > Header Position -  Overlap Content.

fields.label: Overlap Content (mobile)
fields.name: header_fixed_overlap_mobile
fields.instructions: If enabled, the header will behave like "relative" header. This option will override the global option set in Customizer > Header > General > Header Position -  Overlap Content.

fields.label: Custom Logo
fields.name: custom_logo
fields.instructions: Add an image here if you want this page to display a different logo image. If using a Header - Global Section, make sure the Header - Logo element doesn't have "Override settings" option enabled.

fields.label: Custom Mobile Logo
fields.name: logo_mobile
fields.instructions: Add an image here if you want this page to display a different *mobile* logo image. If using a Header - Global Section, make sure the Header - Logo element doesn't have "Override settings" option enabled.

fields.label: Container width
fields.name: custom_container_width
fields.instructions: Select the page container width.

fields.label: Apply only to main content
fields.name: apply_only_to_main_content
fields.instructions: If enabled, this container width will only be applied to the main content (excluding header, footer etc.)

fields.label: Remove Pre-assigned Global Sections
fields.name: remove_global_sections
fields.instructions: Select if you want to remove the global settings already assigned site-wide in Customizer's options > General settings > Global Sections. Hold CTRL key to select multiple.

fields.label: Redirect
fields.name: general_redirect
fields.instructions: Make this post/page a redirect.

fields.label: Redirect URL
fields.name: redirect_url
fields.instructions: Enter the URL.

fields.label: Sticky Global Section - Top
fields.name: top_sticky_gs
fields.instructions: Select to add or override the sticky top global section option pre-defined in Customizer > General > Sticky Global Sections

fields.label: Activation Offset
fields.name: top_sticky_gs_offset
fields.instructions: At what distance from the top edge should be displayed. Add value in pixels eg: 100 or 200px etc. or a unique id selector, eg: #my_unique_element . If empty it'll be triggered after the site-header exists viewport.

fields.label: Sticky Global Section - Bottom
fields.name: bottom_sticky_gs
fields.instructions: Select to add or override the sticky top global section option pre-defined in Customizer > General > Sticky Global Sections

fields.label: Activation Offset
fields.name: bottom_sticky_gs_offset
fields.instructions: At what distance from the top edge should be displayed. Add value in pixels eg: 100 or 200px etc. or a unique id selector, eg: #my_unique_element . If empty it'll be triggered after the site-header exists viewport.

description: These settings apply for this post/page/taxonomies.

fields.message:
Font Settings

Adjust your website's typography settings. To customize frontend's typography, head over to Customizer > General > Typography.

fields.label: Preload Google Fonts
fields.name: preload_google_fonts
fields.instructions: To optimize your website's performance, you can preload Google fonts which will be shown in Customizer font lists as well as Elementor font lists. Currently Customizer and Elementor are loading their selected fonts separately and this can cause performance issues, like too many fonts loaded or even duplicates.

sub_fields.label: Font Variants
sub_fields.name: font_variants
sub_fields.instructions: Select any font variant you want to load.

sub_fields.label: Font Subsets
sub_fields.name: font_subsets
sub_fields.instructions: Be sure to check Google Fonts app what subsets are supported.

fields.label: Adobe Fonts Project ID (Typekit)
fields.name: adobe_fonts_project_id
fields.instructions: Create a new Adobe Font Web Project and paste here its project ID. After saving this page, you'll be able to notice the new fonts in the fonts lists of Customizer and Elementor.

fields.label: Load all font variants (Customizer)
fields.name: kirki_font_variants
fields.instructions: This will force Customizer's (Kirki framework) Google fonts list to load all variants (font weights). Please be careful about this option as it could generate performance issues because each font variant has its own file which is pretty big. Recommended to be disabled.

fields.label: ACF fields panel
fields.name: acf_fields_panel
fields.instructions: Enable or disable the custom fields panel (ACF Panel) in the WordPress backend menu. Disabled by default.

fields.label: Load Polyfills
fields.name: load_polyfills
fields.instructions:
Polyfills are codes that implements a feature on web browsers that do not support that particular feature.
Generally this applies for older browsers, such as IE11 or early Edge versions.
On request, means that the polyfill will load itself only if that feature is not supported.

fields.label: Singular Settings - Post types support
fields.name: singular_settings_support
fields.instructions: Select on which post types to display the "Singular Settings" options block.
